entities.description: A classification for respondents who have met specific marijuana criteria in the past year.
A classification where respondents meet two or three criteria for marijuana use disorder.
A classification where respondents meet four or five criteria for marijuana use disorder.
A classification where respondents meet six or more criteria for marijuana use disorder.
Using marijuana many times in larger amounts or for a longer time than intended.
Unable to cut down or stop using marijuana despite trying.
Spending a lot of time using, obtaining, or recovering from the effects of marijuana.
A strong desire or urge to use marijuana.
Issues caused by marijuana use affecting work, school, or home responsibilities.
Problems with family or friends caused or worsened by marijuana use.
Neglecting important social, occupational, or recreational activities due to marijuana use.
Increased risk of physical harm due to marijuana use.
Continued use of marijuana despite emotional, mental, or physical problems it causes.
Needing more marijuana to get the desired effect or getting less effect with the same amount.
Showing withdrawal symptoms after cutting down or stopping marijuana use.
Feeling irritable or angry during marijuana withdrawal.
Feeling anxious or nervous during marijuana withdrawal.
Having trouble sleeping during marijuana withdrawal.
Losing appetite or weight during marijuana withdrawal.
Feeling restless during marijuana withdrawal.
Feeling depressed during marijuana withdrawal.

relationships.description: Defines the criteria for classifying marijuana use disorder.
Classified as a mild disorder if two or three criteria are met.
Classified as a moderate disorder if four or five criteria are met.
Classified as a severe disorder if six or more criteria are met.
Marijuana use disorder includes various marijuana-related problems.
Leads to using marijuana many times in larger amounts or for a longer time than intended.
Leads to experiencing marijuana withdrawal symptoms.
Includes irritability or anger as a withdrawal symptom.
Includes anxiety or nervousness as a withdrawal symptom.
Includes sleep problems as a withdrawal symptom.
Includes appetite loss or weight loss as a withdrawal symptom.
Includes restlessness as a withdrawal symptom.
Includes depression as a withdrawal symptom.
